questions.text: In the beginning of the episode, who does not go bowling?
questions.explanation:
Chris.

	Chris doesn't appear in the episode until about halfway through when Peter starts eating nickels.  This episode marks the first appearance of Joe and Cleveland in the fourth season.

questions.text: Joe bowls a perfect game at the bowling alley.
questions.explanation:
False.

	By having the ball move very slowly down the lane, it is Mort who somehow manages to bowl a strike every time he plays.  He is made a local hero, and Peter feels jealous.

questions.text: Who does Quagmire spy on in the washroom at the bowling alley?
questions.explanation:
Lois.

	When Lois goes to the bathroom, she discovers that Quagmire is looking down in her stall from the ceiling.  Quagmire goes to jail for the night and the gang tries to stop his sexual tendencies.

questions.text: Where does Quagmire save a woman's life?
questions.explanation:
In the mall.

	After discovering the surveillance room in the mall, he notices that a woman is choking in her dressing room, so he runs to her and performs CPR.  Peter becomes jealous again because another of his friends is a local hero.

Auctioneer.

	In a short flashback, we are shown that Cleveland used to be a really fast-talking auctioneer, but he started talking really slow when he was accidentally ht in the head with a totem pole.

questions.text: What does Peter eat to try and break a world record?
questions.explanation:
Nickels.

	After eating so many nickels, Peter's stomach begins to sound like a bag of loose coins.  Soon, Peter goes blind because of nickel poisoning.

questions.text: What is the name of the seeing-eye dog that Peter gets?
questions.explanation:
Brutus.

	Brian is a bit shocked that Peter would get a seeing-eye dog since he is a dog, but he decides to let Peter go along with it.  Before entering The Drunken Clam, Peter unknowingly ties the dog to a homeless man's neck and it runs away.

questions.text: Who does Peter save from the fire in The Drunken Clam?
questions.explanation:
Horace.

	After God himself accidentally sets fire to the bar, Horace is trapped under flaming debris behind the bar.  Since Peter was blind, he had no idea that he save Horace from the fire until Tom Tucker told him what happened.

questions.text: Does Peter get his sight back?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	Peter gets a new pair of eyes from the homeless man that he killed by tying the dog around his neck.  Again, everything goes back to normal, and finally, Peter is a local hero.

questions.text: Who does not appear in this episode?
questions.explanation:
The greased up deaf guy.

	The greased up deaf guy actually appeared in the first two episodes from this season.  During this episode, the chicken from the episode "Da Bomb" takes another attempt to kill Peter.  In the final scene, Peter gets awarded a medal in a satire of the final scene from "Star Wars: A New Hope".  This episode was first aired during the week that "Star Wars: Revenge of the Sith" opened in theatres.
